page.title: 04Harbour Marina Development
page.content: Work began in 1984 on a Â£16 million multi-purpose to develop the beautiful north arm of St.Peter Port harbour. Due for completion in 1988 this scheme will provide a new 20 acre marina with moorings for 800 local and visiting boats. One thousand new car-parking spaces will be created and a roundabout to ease traffic congestion into the town. These will be increased facilities for local marine trades, berthing areas in the existing harbour will be improved by dredging and new space for containers and ro-ro traffic. Some 80 workers have been directly involved as well as backup from quarrymen, lorry drivers etc. Guernsey's Board of Administration, which is responsible for the project, is confident that it will be of major long term benefit to the Island.
